page.title: 19Newtown Fete, Ashford
page.content: Each year in July, a fete is held on Newtown Green. Usually there are lots od games and stalls selling ice-cream and hamburgers. This year there were donkey-rides, races, tugs-of-war, and a fun-castle to bounce on. There was an Aunt Sally, where you throw wet sponges at a person's face, which is poking through a wooden picture. In the race for 9-ll years old, Christian Addy won, Tommy Dixon was second, Robert Dixon was third, and Stephen MacMillan came fourth. All the boys go to East Stour C.P. School. There was a tug-of-war between Newtown and South Willesborough which the latter won. There was also a game called Splat the Rat. Someone drops a pretend rat down a tube and you have to hit where you think the rat is. The fete started at ll o'clock and went on until tea-time.
